weather_pictures_metadata.title: Large hailstones after storm
weather_pictures_metadata.description: Collected hailstones with scale (cm) showing their unusual size.

weather_pictures_metadata.title: Layered hailstones close-up
weather_pictures_metadata.description: Detailed view showing concentric layers in large hailstones. After the storm, when the sun returned and the hailstones started melting, a strong smell like arc welding was detected all over the site.

weather_pictures_metadata.title: Cumulonimbus incus
weather_pictures_metadata.description: Mature thunderstorm cloud with characteristic anvil top, sign of strong convection.

weather_pictures_metadata.title: Freezing fog ice needles
weather_pictures_metadata.description: Wind-driven deposition of supercooled fog creating aligned ice needles; residual mist visible.

weather_pictures_metadata.title: Mammatus clouds
weather_pictures_metadata.description: Dramatic mammatus cloud formation associated with an intense convective storm.

weather_pictures_metadata.title: Rainbow at sunset
weather_pictures_metadata.description: Spring rainbow at sunset over the bocage landscape, after a passing shower.

weather_pictures_metadata.title: Sunset with inversion
weather_pictures_metadata.description: Sunset above a visible thermal inversion layer typical of foothill climates.
